title: Pastel Valentine single-screen with evasive “No” and meme reveal

requirements.summary: Create a single-screen Valentine prompt UI with the text “Be my Valentine Richaa” and two buttons: “Yes” and “No”.
acceptanceCriteria: The main prompt text renders as “Be my Valentine Richaa”.
Two clearly labeled buttons are visible: “Yes” and “No”.
The page functions as a single-screen experience (no additional required navigation to complete the interaction).

file_operations.description: Implement the single-screen Valentine UI view (prompt + “Yes”/“No” buttons) as the app’s primary rendered experience, keeping the entire flow on this screen.
Ensure the application renders the new single-screen Valentine App component (and that existing providers continue to wrap it).
Add Tailwind base layers and any minimal global styles needed to support the single-screen layout (e.g., full-height root).

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button evasive so it repositions on pointer proximity/hover and on touch attempts, preventing any successful decline action.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, moving the cursor onto/near the “No” button causes it to reposition immediately.
On touch devices (iPad/Chrome), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to reposition before a successful click/tap can be registered.
The “No” button never triggers a “decline” state; only “Yes” can complete the flow.

file_operations.description: Implement evasive behavior for the “No” button using pointer/mouse/touch events and container-bounded random repositioning (e.g., reacting to pointer enter/move and touch/pointer down) so the button cannot be successfully clicked/tapped and never triggers any decline state.

requirements.summary: On “Yes”, transition to a reveal state that shows the generated meme image and the exact promised message.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” transitions to a success/reveal view.
The reveal view displays the meme image.
The reveal view displays the exact message: “Promise I will always support u and protect u pondatiii ummmmaa”.

file_operations.description: Add a client-side reveal state that replaces/overlays the question UI after clicking “Yes”, rendering (1) the meme image and (2) the exact message “Promise I will always support u and protect u pondatiii ummmmaa”.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent soft pastel romantic theme (pastel pink/white + soft accents) across the Valentine UI using Tailwind CSS.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI uses a soft pastel pink/white palette (not bright/vibrant).
Buttons and text are readable with accessible contrast.
Styling is implemented via Tailwind utility classes (and/or Tailwind theme tokens) consistent across the page.

file_operations.description: Apply Tailwind utility classes for a soft pastel romantic layout (background, typography, spacing, button styling) consistently across both the prompt and reveal states.
Extend Tailwind theme tokens (colors/shadows/radii as needed) to support a soft pastel pink/white romantic palette that can be reused consistently across the page.
Define any supporting CSS variables used by Tailwind theme tokens (if needed) to achieve the soft pastel romantic palette while maintaining readable contrast.

requirements.summary: Add the generated meme image as a static frontend asset and render it in the reveal view without backend calls.
acceptanceCriteria: The meme image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated/ and is referenced by the frontend via a static path.
The reveal view successfully loads the image in a production build without any backend calls.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static meme asset file at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme-good-choice.dim_1024x1024.png for use in the reveal view.

Reference and render the static generated meme image from the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme-good-choice.dim_1024x1024.png within the reveal state, ensuring it loads via static asset serving (no backend calls).
